content: loop chain one equivalent *yarn over and pull through two loops * repeat from * to * until only one loop remains on the hook 62 sts row 2 forward pass work tfs pull up a loop in the space between the first two sts *pull up a loop in the space between the next two sts * repeat from * to * across until the final two sts remain do not pull up a loop between the last two sts pull up a loop in the edge st making sure to go under both bars doing so creates a tidy edge that we will use to stitch into to create the border later return pass work return pass as established 62 sts row 3 forward pass work tfs skip the space between the first two sts *pull up a loop in the space between the next two sts * repeat from * to * across pull up a loop in the space between the final two sts then pull up a loop in the edge st making sure you re working under both bars return pass work return pass as established 62 sts color pattern ● repeat row 2 and 3 until you have completed 16 total row in color a ● change to color b and repeat row 2 and 3 for 8 row ● repeat this color sequence three times total after completing the final repeat switch back to color a and work row 2 and 3 for 16 row bind off the sts but do not fasten_off we will now make the border border round 1 rs insert hook into the nearest corner st half_double_crochet in that corner *half_double_crochet across the side until the next corner st half_double_crochet chain 2 half_double_crochet in the corner st* repeat from * to * around at the beginning corner into the same first st half_double_crochet chain 2 then slip_stitch into first half_double_crochet to join round 2 change color chain 2 counts as first half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in first chain 2 space *half_double_crochet in the third loop of each st across the side until next corner half_double_crochet chain 2 half_double_crochet in chain 2 space of corner* repeat from * to * around half_double_crochet into the chain 2 space chain 2 then join with slip_stitch to top of the first half_double_crochet repeat round 2 for desired width of border i was able to repeat 4 times before running out of yarn notes ● the 3rd loop is the loop furthest from you located on the back side working half_double_crochet in the 3rd loop creates a raised knit-like texture and keeps the border flat finished size approx 47 x 34 after steam blocking the tunisian full stitch is very stretchy especially vertically so with strategic blocking using the pattern provided a wide range of lengths/widths could be achieved this blanket pattern could be very easily adjusted to a longer/shorter length by continuing the color pattern longer prior to the final repeat adjusting to a
